articles.headline: Theresa May Will Reach Out to Corbyn in Bid to Avoid Disorderly Brexit
articles.snippet: The prime minister made the surprising offer after a fractious meeting with her cabinet, and said she would seek a second delay to Britain’s withdrawal from the bloc.
articles.abstract: The prime minister made the surprising offer after a fractious meeting with her cabinet, and said she would seek a second delay to Britain’s withdrawal from the bloc.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Theresa May on Tuesday broke with her own party, appealing to the opposition to work with her on a plan in a move that could keep Britain closely tied to the European Union after the country leaves the bloc.
articles.byline: By Stephen Castle and Ellen Barry

articles.headline: Media Companies Take a Big Gamble on Apple
articles.snippet: Executives have been burned by their previous dealings with big tech companies. But Apple’s promise of a billion devices worldwide was too good to pass up. Even for Rupert Murdoch.
articles.abstract: Executives have been burned by their previous dealings with big tech companies. But Apple’s promise of a billion devices worldwide was too good to pass up. Even for Rupert Murdoch.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like many other media executives, Pamela Wasserstein was wary of tech giants and their attempts to go into business with content creators.

articles.headline: Drug Sites Upend Doctor-Patient Relations: ‘It’s Restaurant-Menu Medicine’
articles.snippet: A new wave of websites turns physicians into mere gatekeepers for popular lifestyle drugs, increasing public health risks, experts say. The sites say they ease connections with doctors.
articles.abstract: A new wave of websites turns physicians into mere gatekeepers for popular lifestyle drugs, increasing public health risks, experts say. The sites say they ease connections with doctors.
articles.lead_paragraph: The sites promise easy and embarrassment-free access to erectile dysfunction and libido pills. “E.D. meds prescribed online, delivered to your door,” one said recently. “Starting at $2 per dose.”
articles.byline: By Natasha Singer and Katie Thomas

articles.headline: Lori Lightfoot Is Elected Chicago Mayor, Becoming First Black Woman to Lead City
articles.snippet: Ms. Lightfoot, a former federal prosecutor, ran as an outsider in a city that has often picked insiders. She is also Chicago’s first openly gay mayor.
articles.abstract: Ms. Lightfoot, a former federal prosecutor, ran as an outsider in a city that has often picked insiders. She is also Chicago’s first openly gay mayor.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Chicago became the largest American city ever to elect a black woman as its mayor as voters on Tuesday chose Lori Lightfoot, a former prosecutor, to replace Rahm Emanuel. When she takes office in May, Ms. Lightfoot also will be the city’s first openly gay mayor.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman, Mitch Smith and Monica Davey

articles.headline: Biden’s Tactile Politics Threaten His Return in the #MeToo Era
articles.snippet: In a political career that stretches 50 years, Joseph R. Biden Jr. has been a master of an in-your-space intimacy that is proving to be a liability.
articles.abstract: In a political career that stretches 50 years, Joseph R. Biden Jr. has been a master of an in-your-space intimacy that is proving to be a liability.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Joseph R. Biden Jr. came up in politics as an old-school backslapper whose greatest strength was his ability to connect. He doled out handshakes and hugs to friends and strangers alike, and his tendency to lavish his affections on women and girls was so central to his persona that it became fodder for late-night television jokes.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Sydney Ember

articles.headline: Japan Stumbles as China’s Growth Engine Slows
articles.snippet: A slump in exports raises questions about how effective Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s economic policies would have been without Chinese help.
articles.abstract: A slump in exports raises questions about how effective Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s economic policies would have been without Chinese help.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The Nidec Corporation likes to say it makes everything that “spins and moves,” from the intricate motors that whir in hard drives to the hulking ones used on oil rigs.

articles.headline: Short of Workers, U.S. Builders and Farmers Crave More Immigrants
articles.snippet: As a tight labor market raises costs, employers say the need for low-wage help can’t be met by the declining ranks of the native-born.
articles.abstract: As a tight labor market raises costs, employers say the need for low-wage help can’t be met by the declining ranks of the native-born.
articles.lead_paragraph: It takes Carlos Rojas two and a half to three hours to drive from his home in Stockton, Calif., to a job spreading plaster on houses going up in Campbell, on the southern rim of Silicon Valley. The trip is worth it, though. The 30-year-old immigrant from the Mexican state of Oaxaca says he makes roughly $25 an hour, depending on the job. That’s more than twice as much as Stockton’s farmworkers typically make in the fields. And his boss pays for gas.

articles.headline: Trump’s Takeover of the Republican Party Is Almost Complete
articles.snippet: The Trump campaign has helped install allies atop the most significant state parties, and has urged them to discourage conservative criticism of the president.
articles.abstract: The Trump campaign has helped install allies atop the most significant state parties, and has urged them to discourage conservative criticism of the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Election Day in 2016, the Republican Party was divided against itself, split over its nominee for president, Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Accenture Is Buying Droga5, an Ad Agency, Making a Bet on Creativity
articles.snippet: The deal for the highly regarded independent agency highlights the ad industry’s rapidly changing competitive landscape.
articles.abstract: The deal for the highly regarded independent agency highlights the ad industry’s rapidly changing competitive landscape.
articles.lead_paragraph: Accenture is trying to add the kind of creative muscle not normally associated with giant consulting firms with its plans to buy Droga5, an independent ad agency. Now it needs to make sure the two cultures merge without squelching the energy that made the agency such a standout.

articles.headline: Alabama’s Gruesome Prisons: Report Finds Rape and Murder at All Hours
articles.snippet: In a grim report on the Alabama prison system, the Justice Department detailed violence that was “common, cruel,” and “of an unusual nature.”
articles.abstract: In a grim report on the Alabama prison system, the Justice Department detailed violence that was “common, cruel,” and “of an unusual nature.”
articles.lead_paragraph: One prisoner had been dead for so long that when he was discovered lying face down, his face was flattened. Another was tied up and tortured for two days while no one noticed. Bloody inmates screamed for help from cells whose doors did not lock.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner and Shaila Dewan
